channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023110477
item.description:
Report E-2023110477

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of sulfuric acid damaging one of the inner poly bottle and releasing 0.25 liters of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023111286
item.description:
Report X-2023111286

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED DISTRESSED/STAINED IN APPEARANCE IN THE OVERGOOD'S CAGE BY A CLERK ALSO CERTIFIED AS A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. AFTER DONNING PROPER PPE, UTILIZING A FULLY STOCKED RESPONSE CART AND FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE PARCEL WAS CONTAINED (NO ACTIVE SPILLAGE) THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA.

item.title: Report E-2023110236
item.description:
Report E-2023110236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSJ experienced a UN1866 P077-310 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of material released to a 20’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor, a 20’ x 15’ area of the concrete dock floor and a 12’ x 8’ area of the concrete lot below the trailer due to a puncture caused by impact with other freight. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris were containerized into (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON A IRREG TRAM. RESPONDER BROUGHT TO THE DMP AREA. RESPONDER CLEANED THE TUG WITH ABSORBANT TOWELS AND CLAY. PLACED THE BUCKET IN A LINED TRAY AND PROCEDED TO PROCESS THE DMN.

item.title: Report E-2023110029
item.description:
Report E-2023110029

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately .75 gallons of Acetone (hazardous - UN1090) was released. The released product was contained to the dock floor and has dried, the remaining product and damaged jug were placed into a 25 gallon metal drum and staged onsitel for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110046
item.description:
Report X-2023110046

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: One of the gallon jugs cap was loose allowing contents to leak out during transit. (Motion of trailer going down Hwy caused movement of liquid to cap allowing leakage.) DescribePack: Cap was not secured tightly and when box experienced motion and came in contact with loose lid contents leaked out. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Box opened and lid secured.

item.title: Report X-2023110031
item.description:
Report X-2023110031

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: i was told it happened in the unload, it was in the cage when i got to it. it was properly placed in a yellow drum. DescribePack: small crack at the top of the lid causing a leaking hazmat. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill pads and put in a sealed hazmat tote.
